instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.R7021: What is R7021? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7022: What is R7022? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shut off when magsafe unplugged.
threads.message:
this mac came dead, previously  worked on other store, 
replace <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> cause its ugly as f, with blown <RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7022</RESISTOR>, and <RESISTOR>R7025</RESISTOR> out of value, <RESISTOR>R7001</RESISTOR> out of value, all replaced, value good.|
now mac will turn on, see battery, can charge the battery.
but unplugging magsafe will shutdown the mac.
but this mac can run off battery fine.
any idea whats causing this ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shut off when magsafe unplugged.
threads.message:
Is not very clear, how can run with battery alone?
You've said turns off when unplug the charger.
Try a better way to explain actual situation.

Run corresponding ASD...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shut off when magsafe unplugged.
threads.message:
no no its bizarre i know.
mac will turn on with battery connected, and run off battery.
BUT if I attach charger to it and then rip it out, mac will shut down.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shut off when magsafe unplugged.
threads.message:
There must be something else corroded near <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.
Check <RESISTOR>R7000</RESISTOR> first.
Be sure all traces and solders are good.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shut off when magsafe unplugged.
threads.message:
so i found out, that mac only behave like this with BIL connected.
if I unplug BIL, its normal.
Using KNOWN good BIL will still behave like that, so the problem is still from logicboard..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shut off when magsafe unplugged.
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R7000</RESISTOR> value is normal, 0 ohm.
checked all traces around <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>, all is connected

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shut off when magsafe unplugged.
threads.message:
Check <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> signal with BIL connected.
Inspect around J6955 for corrosion; pins and caps.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shut off when magsafe unplugged.
threads.message: theres 3.4v at smc <SIGNAL>LID_R</SIGNAL> whether BIL is connected or disconnected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shut off when magsafe unplugged.
threads.message:
BIL can only affect lid signal, or battery bus.
So test with known good battery.
